text: 2. The integers F,, = 22" + 1 are called Fermat Numbers. Fermat conjectures that these integers are primes. Indeed, the first few Fermat numbers are primes, namely Fy =3, F =5, F, =17, F3 = 257, and F; = 65,537 and these are all prime numbers. However Fy =22 +1 is divisible by 641 and is not prime! Show that every composite Fermat number F,, = 2%" + 1 is a pseudoprime to the base 2. (3 pts)
